verses.text_plain: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.verse_html:
1If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep. ▼
▼ or a sheep: or, or a goat

footnotes.body_text: ▼ or a sheep: or, or a goat
footnotes.body_html: ▼ or a sheep: or, or a goat

verses.text_plain: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.
verses.verse_html: 2If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.

verses.text_plain: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.verse_html: 3If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him; for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.

tokens.text: if he have nothing, then he shall be sold

verses.text_plain: If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.
verses.verse_html: 4If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.

verses.text_plain: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
verses.verse_html: 5If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.

verses.text_plain: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
verses.verse_html: 6If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed therewith; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

tokens.text: so that the stacks of corn

verses.text_plain: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.
verses.verse_html: 7If a man shall deliver unto his neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief be found, let him pay double.

verses.text_plain: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods.
verses.verse_html: 8If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods.

verses.text_plain: For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.
verses.verse_html: 9For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whom the judges shall condemn, he shall pay double unto his neighbour.

tokens.text: for any manner of lost thing

verses.text_plain: If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
verses.verse_html: 10If a man deliver unto his neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:

verses.text_plain: Then shall an oath of the Lord be between them both, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods; and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.
verses.verse_html: 11Then shall an oath of the Lord be between them both, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbour’s goods; and the owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.

verses.text_plain: And if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
verses.verse_html: 12And if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.

tokens.text: from him, he shall make restitution

verses.text_plain: If it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.
verses.verse_html: 13If it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.

tokens.text: If it be torn in pieces

verses.text_plain: And if a man borrow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.
verses.verse_html: 14And if a man borrow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good.

verses.text_plain: But if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.
verses.verse_html: 15But if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.

verses.text_plain: And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.
verses.verse_html: 16And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.

verses.text_plain: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
verses.verse_html:
17If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins. ▼
▼ pay: Heb. weigh

tokens.text: her unto him, he shall pay

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
verses.verse_html: 18Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.

tokens.text: Thou shalt not suffer a witch

verses.text_plain: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
verses.verse_html: 19Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.

verses.text_plain: He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto the Lord only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
verses.verse_html: 20He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto the Lord only, he shall be utterly destroyed.

tokens.text: only, he shall be utterly destroyed

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 21Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

verses.text_plain: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
verses.verse_html: 22Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.

verses.text_plain: If thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
verses.verse_html: 23If thou afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;

verses.text_plain: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
verses.verse_html: 24And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

verses.text_plain: If thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.
verses.verse_html: 25If thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.

tokens.text: by thee, thou shalt not be to him as an usurer

verses.text_plain: If thou at all take thy neighbour’s raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:
verses.verse_html: 26If thou at all take thy neighbour’s raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it unto him by that the sun goeth down:

verses.text_plain: For that is his covering only, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
verses.verse_html: 27For that is his covering only, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.

tokens.text: and it shall come to pass, when he crieth
unto me, that I will hear

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.
verses.verse_html:
28Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people. ▼
▼ gods: or, judges

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
verses.verse_html:
29Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give unto me. ▼
▼ the first…: Heb. thy fulness
 , ▼
▼ liquors: Heb. tear

tokens.text: the first of thy ripe fruits

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the first…: Heb. thy fulness

verses.text_plain: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
verses.verse_html: 30Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.

tokens.text: it shall be with his dam

verses.text_plain: And ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
verses.verse_html: 31And ye shall be holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.

tokens.text: unto me: neither shall ye eat
